title: ComicPirates Weeklies (2012.04 - 2014.02).rar
description:
Contains:   477 torrent metadata files, covering all Weeklies (plus a few Monthlies
and one Annual) posted in the stated period by  <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipJ" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipJ</a>
and  <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipjolly" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipjolly</a>   , in two lightly compressed archives.

---

I drastically shortened and systematized the filenames, which now consist of four snippets (or "tokens", if you're into programmerese), separated by underscores.

   7696241_2012.09.26_HL.03.R1_T-X.torrent      (Weekly)
   7743121_2012.10.00_HL.02.R2_A-Z.torrent      (Monthly)
   9450218_2013.00.00_0D.01.R1_9-Z.torrent      (Annual)

First snippet:  TPB identifier of the torrent. I put this on the left to get them in chronological order, plus you can use it to construct the upload page URL directly.

Second snippet: Date per torrent name. Ordinary dates refer to Weeklies, while those with a 00 in the day or month positions refer to Monthlies or Annuals, respectively.

Third snippet:  Type of torrent. In order, 0D(ay) or H(it)L(ist), part number, and revision (1 for the regulars, 2 for "fixes", "repacks", "fillers", and so forth).

Fourth snippet: Initial letters of first and last files contained. Occasionally meaningless when torrent wasn't alphabetized, but quite useful otherwise, I'd say.

---

Any mistakes made in the original titles are (deliberately) preserved here, so trust the first and last tokens rather than the ones in the middle, whenever in doubt. :)
